meanings.definition: A selection from the Prophets read in synagogue following the Torah reading on Sabbaths and festivals.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haftara aloud to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The haftara is an important part of the Sabbath service in the synagogue.
meanings.sent3: The haftara seemed to whisper ancient wisdom to those listening.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the synagogue like a haunting haftara.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haftara lingered in the air long after it was read.

meanings.definition: To read or chant the haftara.
meanings.sent1: He will haftara the passage with great reverence.
meanings.sent2: Every Saturday, the cantor will haftara beautifully for the congregation.
meanings.sent3: She decided to haftara the text in a dramatic fashion, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The way he haftaraed the verses brought tears to the eyes of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The young boy practiced diligently to haftara flawlessly during the service.
